project.description: Port of the perl-based NCBI-Gene-Load to Java

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: LOAD_NCBI_ONE_WAY_GENES
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: Enable this flag to additionally add NCBI genes that have a link to ZFIN without an equivalent link back from ZFIN to NCBI. These are validated by having a shared ensembl id. See ZFIN-8517 for details.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# working dir can be set to old path with: # export WORKING_DIR=$TARGETROOT/server_apps/data_transfer/NCBIGENE/
# set working dir to jenkins workspace export WORKING_DIR=$WORKSPACE
# clear the working directory rm -rf $WORKING_DIR/legacy_reports rm -f $WORKING_DIR/*
# optionally, copy the stored load files instead of downloading them # cp /research/zarchive/load_files/NCBI-gene-load-archive/2025-07-30/* $WORKING_DIR
# Some options to skip steps for troubleshooting # SKIP_DOWNLOADS means to use cached local files instead of downloading them # export SKIP_DOWNLOADS=1
# EARLY_EXIT means quit the job before actually running the sql files against the DB (useful for checking expected results in .unl files) # export EARLY_EXIT=1
# SKIP_EFETCH means do not run logic to "efetch" sequences from ncbi endpoint to build seq.fasta file for calculating sequence lengths # export SKIP_EFETCH=1
# FORCE_EFETCH means to force run the efetch logic # export FORCE_EFETCH=1
# Run the gradle task from source directory cd $SOURCEROOT
# Option for troubleshooting: load the database from a backup # gradle loaddb -DB=/research/zunloads/databases/zfindb/2025.07.28.1/2025.07.28.1.bak
# Optionally run liquibase (temporary for now until the DB is updated with the new tables marker_annotation_status, etc.) # gradle liquibasePostBuild
# Run the NCBI gene load gradle ncbiPort
